resources.string: The Show Must Go On
Gather Black Pigment from Black Fungus around Ebonscale Reach for Magistrate Redridge.
"Why is that?"

We were betrayed by the Dynasty Empress, but we've adapted - we've learned that the secret is not forgetting what makes us human.\n\nThat's why practicing the arts remains one of our highest priorities.
"Really? What type of arts?"

Theater! In fact, I've written a historical piece about the the Taiying Empress' journey to Aeternum.\n\nBut I have only one copy of the script - we need more for the actors, and well, we've run out of ink.
"Maybe I can help?"

You could. The black fungus that grows around Ebonscale Reach actually contains the perfect pigment.\n\nIf you could gather enough, we could mix up more ink. You would be honored for supporting the arts, dearie.
I do think the fungus will make for an excellent ink.\n\nThis is the only way we can pull off the production.

Ah, perfect! I'll start mixing the ink right away, and then I can recopy my script for 'The Empress's Journey'.\n\nI realize what a trifle this must seem in the face of the Corrupted, but we must follow through.
Collect {itemName} from Void Pitchers around Ebonscale Reach
Statuette Stash
Collect four Dragon Statuettes to deliver to Zeng Lingyun in Ebonscale so she can locate the dock leading to the Empress's fleet.
"Do you know why she fell?"

Yes. Her thirst for power overcame her sense of respect and decorum. It is a tragic tale.\n\nThe past is gone, however, and it is the present for which I am now concerned. The Empress is a threat to the entire world.
"A threat to the entire world?"

Taiying was once a beloved leader and a caring confidant. She dreamt of returning to our homeland and retaking her throne.\n\nThose aspirations twisted her mind, and she has now constructed an entire Corrupted fleet to sail abroad.
"Is there some way to stop her?"

Yes, we must defeat her and destroy her ships, but simply reaching her is the difficult part.\n\nThere are dragon statuettes at shrines around Ebonscale, in Aeternum's elements of Fire, Water, Earthâ€¦ And Air! You thought I was going to say Wood and Metal, didn't you? These are Aeternum-made statuettes and obey the island's elemental rules.
The dragon statuettes are the only way to gain access to the Empress's docks.
Ah, thank you. Empress Taiying fancies herself a dragon goddess, but she is only a human who has succumbed to Corruption.\n\nWith you as our champion, I believe we can bring her down for good.
Collect the {itemName} from the Air Shrine
Collect the {itemName} from the Water Shrine
Collect the {itemName} from the Earth Shrine
Collect the {itemName} from the Fire Shrine
End of Her Reign (Expedition)

Enter the boat in the Dynasty Fortress, sail to the Dynasty Port, defeat Dynasty Captains and destroy her ships, and then defeat Empress Zhou Taiying herself. Then report back to Zeng Lingyun in the Ebonscale Settlement.
"Where is she?"

You will find her, and her entire fleet, within the Dynasty Shipyard. I do not know exactly where, so you will have to search inside. \n\nI hope you realize the importance of this - she cannot be permitted to launch that fleet.
"Could she get past the Stormwall?"

At first, we all hoped the Empress would come to realize the futility of her plan.\n\nNow, we have learned her plan includes some way of pushing through. I know not how - only that she must be stopped. Good luck, Champion.
Whatever it takes, you must destroy Empress Laiying and her foul fleet.\n\nNot just for Aeternum, but for all the world.
Ah, I have heard the news - at last her dark reign has ended.\n\nThank you, Champion. You have put a deeply troubled soul to rest, and in doing so, you may have very well saved the world.
Defeat the Empress at {POITags}
Defeat {targetName}
Captain's Orders
Defeat Undead Pirates and obtain the Captain's Puzzlebox for Elder Danya in the Ebonscale Reach Settlement.
"I came from the southern territories."

Perfect, perfect. Then you are familiar with these Lost Pirates - they are plague down there, and here as well.\n\nThey also present us with an opportunity to acquire supplies we cannot get elsewhere.
"What kind of supplies?"

Ah! One of the pirates' wrecks contains some cargo that is even more precious than azoth. \n\nIt is something so scarce on Aeternum that I hesitate to speak its name aloud lest we be overheard by covetous interlopers.
"You want me to retrieve this cargo?"

For now, I only need the manifest, to verify the contents of what is stored on the ship.\n\nRumors say it is locked inside a puzzlebox - find this puzzlebox, and get me the manifest within, and I will see you rewarded.
Find the Puzzlebox and recover the manifest within, and then you know what I value most in this world.
You have the manifest? Then you have found me out. \n\nThere is one thing I value in this world more than anything, and that is... Fine literature. Mmm.
Retrieve cargo from {POITags}
Kill {targetName}
Kill {targetName} for the {itemName}
Flower for the Departed
Place a Blossoming Flower on the Altar of the Departed in the Haunted Crypt for Elder Danya in the Ebonscale Reach Settlement.
"That's not surprising."
You must understand - the people here - many have actually been given the comfort of eternal rest. \n\nIt's a blessing after they've endured so much at the hands of the Empress.
"How does that happen?"
A sacred ceremony brought from their homeland, but forgotten in the disaster.\n\nIf you can take this Blossoming Flower to the Shrine of the Departed, it will bring them peace... or so I hope.
The Blossoming Flower, for how full of life it is, should help the spirits rest.
Oh, I was just reading a book of Bhakti kaal. Not enough to share I'm afraid.\n\nBut you placed the Blossoming Flower? Did it help the drowned Dynasty citizens find rest?
"Not that I could tell."

Hmm. Perhaps it will work in time. At the very least, you've brought peace for some surviving citizens here.\n\nIt should feel good to do good - not as good as the satisfaction of completing an epic poem, but still good, I hope.
Honor the flood victims at {POITags}
Place the Blossoming Flower on the Altar of the Departed
Hidden
Defeat The Cursed One
Ebonscale Alligators
Collect Ebony Scales from Ebonscale Alligators for Survivalist Hopkins in the Ebonscale Reach Settlement.
"I'm always up for a challenge."

Excellent! Let's make it a competition, then! Who can skin the most Ebonscale Alligators?\n\nThere's a hollow in Moss Mire that teems with them. Gather their scales, and I'll make you a fine new gatorskin satchel.
"Gatorksin bag?"
You can always use more bags lugging your loot around Aeternum, no? \n\nAre you up for the challenge?

I have to admit that this challenge is not only for the bag and the bragging rights. \n\nThese alligators are a threat - have you ever been drowned and eaten by a gator? It's an experience that haunts you forever.
Impressive! As much as it pains me to say it, you are a better Insti-gator than I am! Heh? You like it? My pun game is as sharp as their teeth.\n\nAs promised, here is your new bag.
Invade the {POITags}
Defeat {targetName}
Collect {itemName} from Ebonscale Alligators
What Makes the Shallows Crimson
Collect samples of life in the Crimson Shallows for Barkeep Bao in the Ebonscale Reach Settlement.
"What makes it unique?"

That's the question you can help answer! There are so many unanswered questions on Aeternum - it keeps me awake at night!\n\n If we could just answer this one, I would be happy. What makes the Crimson Shallows crimson?
"Why is this question so important?"

Because it has perplexed me since I arrived as a stowaway on the Empress's ship.\n\nThis island's deep mysteries are best left to adventurers and scholars. Gather me samples from the Shallows, and this one, I might solve!
I'll need plants from the area as well as samples from the fauna that eat them. \n\nThank you for assisting me in this endeavor.
Wow, that is a lot of samples! I can certainly find the common element.\n\nI suspect it is an algae-like substance that, when exposed to heat, makes the Shallows red. We will soon find out!
Gather {itemName} from Boars in Crimson Shallows
Gather {itemName} from Peacocks in Crimson Shallows
Gather {itemName} from Water in Ebonscale Reach
Gather {itemName} from Bushes in Crimson Shallows
Corrupted Critics
Sabotage and pillage in the Serenity Monastery for Magistrate Redridge in the Ebonscale Reach Settlement.
"How do we stop them?"

Long ago, the Clifftop Monastery was a place where we could meditate and find solace, but these days, it rings with the din of the Corrupted.\n\nFrom up there, they spy on us and plot to sabotage our initiatives.
"We should sabotage them right back."

Ha! I love the spirit! Yes, they've been operating freely up there too long.\n\nAssault the Monastery and confiscate their plans and the implements of their surveillance. Let their activities be disrupted for a change.
Please, dearie, do make haste and visit the Clifftop Monastery.\n\nIf the Corrupted learn of our enterprise, they will try to take advantage of that.
Finally, the Corrupted are paid back for spoiling the Monastery. This intelligence will prove useful too. \n\nMost importantly, however, we can now begin our rigorous rehearsal schedule.
Sabotage the Corrupted at {POITags}
Collect {itemName} from chests
Collect {itemName} from Corrupted
Set fire to Corrupted Scrolls
Study In Green
Collect Dryad Wood from the Ruins in Moss Mire for Artificer Long in the Ebonscale Reach Settlement.
"Is there some way I can prove it?"

Yes, support me in my work defending the settlement. I need materials for the armaments I would forge.\n\nI have the ores, but I need wood for the hafts and stocks. The Wood of the Dryads would be most effective.
"How much do you need?"
Here, I'll write it down for youâ€¦
In her Corrupted madness, Empress Zhou believes she can build a fleet to sail back there, reclaim her throne and dominate with her Corruption across the whole world. Madness, pure madness.

Ah yes, this Dryad Wood will do nicely. The Angry Earth have a collective magic that is powerful against the Corrupted.\n\nThank you, this will help our settlement be better defended. This proves your heart is pure.
Investigate {POITags}
Collect {itemName} from Dryads
Shrine Cleansing
Cleanse the Dragon Shrine in the Dynasty Shrine for Artificer Long in the Ebonscale Reach Settlement.
"Is there some way I can help?"

Yes. The Dragon Shrine. The Empress and I shared a love for dragons, but she twisted my work into a nexus of evil.\n\nThe Corrupted now use the shrine to conduct foul rituals and concoct dark plans. It must be cleansed.
"How do I cleanse it?"

Take this incense and burn it at the Dragon Shrine, but be prepared - the Corrupted will attempt to stop you.\n\nSearch the shrine for any information on the Empress's strategy as well. It would be useful.
The Dynasty Corrupted are a force to be reckoned with, and they are abetted by Corrupted from the Mainland.\n\nI would not be surprised if you encounter both at the Shrine.
You saw it then? The Shrine I built for her, and what she did to it... overrun with all manner of Corrupted abominations. I was ashamed.\n\nThank for making it right again.
Cleanse the {POITags}
Kill {targetName}
Cleanse the Dragon Shrine
Collect {itemName} from chests
Tiger, Tiger
Defeat Tigers for Trophy Teeth and Defeat Rajah at the Tiger Cave for Survivalist Hopkins in the Ebonscale Reach Settlement.
"Tigers on Aeternum?"

Damn straight, the Empress brought them from the old world, but they've evolved here and become even more dangerous. We have a bounty on them.\n\nThunder Cradle's where the Tigers den. Bring me their teeth, and you'll be rewarded.
"Any tips for hunting them?"

Don't underestimate Rajah and his ambush of tigers. You need to keep your mind as sharp as your blade. \n\nDon't be timid, either. These beasts can smell fear a mile away, so steady your heart before enter their lair.
The Tigers were once pets from the Empress's royal menagerie, but they've learned to be free and wild here.\n\nYou'll not a hunt a more dangerous quarry.

Looks like you really earned your stripes! In fact you could say you were absolutely purr-fect! Ha, don't give me that look, you know you love my puns.\n\nAnd here's your reward, master-hunter. You've earned it.
Hunt at {POITags}
Collect {itemName} from tigers
Defeat {targetName}
Skysong's End
Kill Corrupted forces at Skysong Lagoon to interrupt the Corrupted meeting. Then report back to Artificer Long in the Ebonscale Reach Settlement.
"We should break up this meeting."

That is a bold idea, and one which I would normally consider laughable, but you seemâ€¦ quite capable.\n\nEven you must be careful however; the meeting is set to take place in the Skysong Lagoon Temple.
"Is the Temple dangerous?"

It is the center of the Empress's power, another masterwork I now regret.\n\nIt seems this meeting includes both the Empress's agents and those of the Tempest. If you can defeat them, it would be quite a victory.
These plans suggest the construction of the Empress's fleet is actually a joint effort now with the Tempest.\n\nDisrupting this meeting at the Temple may be the most important thing we can do.

You did it, didn't you? Marched into the Temple and confronted both the Empress's and the Tempest's followers.\n\nThis is a victory that will go down in Aeternum history. I feelâ€¦ quite happy about this, as well.
Disrupt the Corrupted meeting at {POITags}
Destroy {targetName}
Destroy {targetName}
Destroy {targetName}
Temple Troubles
Decimate the Corrupted Population of the Dynasty Mountain Temple and take out their leader Legarath. Then report back to Barkeep Bao in the Ebonscale Reach Settlement.
"What sort of task did you have in mind?"
There is a Dynasty Mountain Temple in Thunder Cradle overseen by a Corrupted warrior who goes by the name Legarath.\n\nIf you can bring down him and his Corrupted ilk it would help me greatly.
"How so?"

Well, you see, Legarath wasn't always Corrupted. He used to be a close companion of mine when we first crashed upon the shores of Aeternum.\n\nIt haunts me to know he chose serving the Empress over his own personal... connections. Taking him down would provide me with some peace of mind.
Has Legarath bested you in battle? Please do not give up. I know his skills are nothing to be scoffed at but I sense power in you, too.\n\nPlease dish out justice in a way I cannot.
So Legarath and the soldiers who followed him into Corruption are defeated. It brings me some solace in the present, but my heart will take time to mend.
Seek out Corrupted at {POITags}
Destroy {targetName}
Destroy {targetName}
Justice For The Dynasty (Expedition)
Obtain Dynasty Shackles from Dynasty Shipyard Lieutenants and return them to Liberator Guo outside the Dynasty Shipyards In Ebonscale.
"Where is the injustice?"
You stand at the precipice of an operation that is centuries in the making. \n\nThe people of Zhou Taiying's Dynasty have been betrayed by her in her turn to Corruption.
"What can I do?"
Zhou's Lieutenants in the Shipyard carry on them barbaric manacles they use to capture and contain anyone they come across.\n\nRob them of their tools and we may prevent further Corruption.
Taking these shackles away from the upper members of her court give adventurers and innocents a fighting chance in running from Taiying's terror.
These devices are truly the tools of an oppressor.\n\nThank you for bringing them to me so I can melt down and repurpose them into something for the good of the people of the Dynasty.
Venture into the Dynasty Shipyard Expedition
Defeat {targetName} for {itemName}
